sentences: Ta ei tahtnud maale elama minna.
context: The Estonian word 'tast' is the third-person singular form of the verb 'tahtma', which means 'to want' or 'to desire'. It indicates someone's desire, wish, or intention to do something or have something. The word can be used in various contexts: expressing personal desires (what someone wants), indicating necessity or requirement (something needs/wants to be done), showing inclination or tendency (things tending to happen), or even in negative constructions where something doesn't want to happen (referring to obstacles or difficulties).
